cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles south of Lake Charles Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest, forecast to turn north-northwest tonight and then northeast Friday, carrying the center toward the Texas-Louisiana border and inland across western Louisiana into Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border (around Cameron Parish, LA)

weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, Texas to the mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: central Texas coast eastward through Louisiana and into the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (3–5 inches expected with isolated 7 inches)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds of 40–50 mph possible late Wednesday night into Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along the southwest Louisiana coast, including areas near Calcasieu Pass
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals near 7 inches may cause flash flooding in the Lake Charles area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands
